names.pinyin: zi zao yang rong tang jia jian
names.hanzi: modified enrich dryness and nourish the constructive decoction
names.commonEnglish: Modified Enrich Dryness and Nourish the Constructive Decoction

actions: Clears Heat, cools the Blood, nourishes Yin and generates fluids.
With Bai Shao, for Blood Deficiency Heat.
With Shu Di Huang, for Heat symptoms due to Yin Deficiency and Devastated Blood.
Nourishes the Blood and nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin.
Nourishes the Blood and astringes Yin.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
With Dang Gui and Shu Di Huang, for dizziness, blurred vision and dysmenorrhea due to Blood Deficiency or Stasis.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, moistens the Intestines and unblocks the bowels.
With Shu Di Huang, for Heat symptoms due to Yin Deficiency and Devastated Blood.
Clears Heat, drains Fire and cools the Blood.
Clears Deficiency Heat and moistens the Intestines.
Clears Heat and unblocks and promotes movement in the channels and collaterals.
Moistens the Lungs, clears Heat, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.

symptoms: This usually occurs in the late stag of a febrile disease
A burning sensation of the fingers
Thirst with a desire to drink

conditions.name: A burning sensation of the fingers
